poem:
### Meeting at No 10

In the corridors of history,  
voices murmur of security lost,  
a handshake between leaders  
beneath a grey, sceptical sky.  
Promises, like autumn leaves,  
scatter on cold winds.  
As I watch from my distant field,  
I wonder if words spoken  
can plant peace  
on this barren earth.
